oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Gladys Brown Webb - letter
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: correspondence; 1930s; Webb, Gladys Brown;
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: "Friday May (June 6,) 1930 -- Dear Miss Brown: This day marks the climax of your high school career and I hope that you have not anything, but pleasant memories of your stay here. As I've watched your activities I have thought of you as a very splendid girl with many possibilities. Gladys, remember that you, yourself can only hinder you from reaching the pinnacle of your ambitions. As a departing word, I would say smile and the whole world smiles with you, but frown and you frown alone. -- Lovingly yours, Dara E. Todd -- 633 So -- Me--
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Todd, Dara E.
